issue.title: I don’t understand the custom filters
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.5

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#cosmetic-rules

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Please I am ready to cry I have read and re read this document multiple times I still don’t understand I find it very confusing I don’t know what any of the symbols mean


I thought by taking html and css courses on YouTube would help me understand your document but I still don’t 

im getting the basics of html and of css

so Is there a course specifically for custom filters? I don’t even know what to look up


What do I look up? 

To learn html all you go to do is search 

Html courses for beginners 

to learn css all you got to do is search 

css courses for beginners 

what I do search to understand your document because I don’t understand it at all it has frustrated me it has made me sad ready to cry


I am trying to understand this so I don’t have to bother any of you and plus you said you won’t help me anyway unless it’s ad related in trying to hide

so please direct me what I need to understand your document because I don’t!!!!
2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: Create Own Filters
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.5

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
and than you have where exactly the info on ^ separator character mark as being any character that is not a letter of alphabet, a digit of number, or these characters  _ - . %

so now I’m thinking okay so basically all these characters will work /:;()$&@“,?!’[]{}#^*+=\|~<>€£¥• 
But than why scrolled up does it say a separator is either this / or this : 

you have this extremely confusing of where I can’t understand 


And than there’s this 

In this example separator characters are shown in bold: http://example.com/?t=1&t2=t3. The end of the address is also accepted as separator.


So I think I understand why in this question mark ?
And and and symbol & are bold because there not a letter there not a number and there not a underscore, dash, period or percentage symbol 

But than you have the slash /

Of which I first thought the slash / and semicolon : we’re the separator character mark

and than you have t=1? 

What does that even mean?

Or t2=t3 

What does that even mean where are you getting this letter and numbers from I don’t get it, 

now the part where it saids the end of an address is also considered a separator 

okay so does that mean https://example.org/

or https://example.org:


None of this makes sense and it’s making me cry, get frustrated and ready to just give up 

2. Screenshots
![8C782A21-D187-4E53-86E5-FA4ED32FAFA8](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118444664/217149516-58a67df9-1af4-4cf4-9cb3-146ed9434ac8.jpeg)
![CB6E670B-2F64-4E2F-B605-056DB7C32334](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118444664/217149519-26689f90-f0a9-4157-a748-8e2c4f9e2ba9.jpeg)
![39F5FD05-F28D-43BB-A921-DA5D476732E1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118444664/217149522-c8d5659b-dbc7-43cf-9838-37342e7f2f05.jpeg)
![DB56C285-4356-4DC4-A4A9-B4AFEE5C51BE](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118444664/217149525-ced40ce3-8625-4d2f-97d5-6946a3dc30eb.jpeg)
![B12AD090-461C-4034-A560-F3CC6C47EA83](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118444664/217149612-050c61cd-2733-4fb1-8569-05928dc608c4.jpeg)

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

issue.title: I don’t understand your document and I even am learning HTML and CSS
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for iOS ### AdGuard version 4.4.5 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Mobile ### Where is the problem encountered? https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#introduction ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I don’t understand this document maybe I’m just too stupid but I don’t understand it at all. I’m even trying to understand html and css and hope that helps me to understand but I still don’t understand your filters Can someone please recommended a video or something that discuss these rules I don’t even know what to look up I tried aduard filters but it all it gave was a 1 minute video of what filters are. I need something that exactly will step by step teach me what all these symbols you guys use to make custom rule filters mean I have tried reading the document multiple times and I still don’t understand it, Please what exactly are these are these same rules any adblocker uses? Or are they only ones you use? What do I look for exactly for instance there are courses on html And courses on csss So what do I call this so I can find a course? I have learned div, Csss Class. ID . * . Ancestor and child .flower {property:value; } .flower {background-color:red; color:blue; font-size;100px} but I still don’t understand your document please will someone help me I am actually trying to learn this my self so I don’t always have to bother you all!!! 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot N:
### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Adblockers' official syntax guides are known to be windy, to say it the least. [This page](https://github.com/DandelionSprout/adfilt/blob/master/Wiki/SyntaxMeaningsThatAreActuallyHumanReadable.md) (Disclosure: I'm the maintainer of that page) should hopefully make it a bit easier.

issue.title: www.newyorker.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.newyorker.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newyorker.com%2F) ### Comment > Images don't load on this particular website. I have tried to find out the filter that's causing it by turning each one on and off and reloading the website. But nothing seems to work. I also had issues with YouTube. However, I found a fix on an Ad Guard forum asking to add googlevideo.com to Advanced Settings filters. Overall, I'm a bit disappointed by the trouble here and there. Especially coming from uBlock Origin, where everything just seems to work. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/QlCseLj.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/d33TdYG.jpg)
